snippet: Tons of contaminated groundwater are emptying into the ocean daily, but the operator of the stricken Fukushima plant has not identified the cause of the problem.
abstract: Tons of contaminated groundwater from stricken Fukushima nuclear plant have overwhelmed underground barrier and are emptying daily into Pacific Ocean, creating what top regulator is calling crisis; Tokyo Electric Power Company, or Tepco, has been unable to stop flow or determine source of contamination, causing worry among experts.

byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Tons of contaminated groundwater are emptying into the ocean daily, but the operator of the stricken Fukushima plant has not identified the cause of the problem.

headline.main: New Leaks Into Pacific at Japan Nuclear Plant
headline.print_headline: New Leaks Into Pacific At Japan Nuclear Plant
